abstract: A new book on Anderson & Sheppard captures the appeal of bespoke tailoring over a century
snippet: A new book on Anderson & Sheppard captures the appeal of bespoke tailoring over a century

keywords.name: unknown
keywords.value: Anderson & Sheppard: A Style is Born (Book)

lead_paragraph: When he was younger, and poorer, Jonathan Becker, the photographer whose wonderful portraits have appeared in Vanity Fair for three decades, had his suits custom made by an English tailor in Argentina who charged him about $60. While working on a book in London about 12 years ago, he decided to have them made at Anderson & Sheppard, the Savile Row tailor, on the recommendation of Graydon Carter and Fran Lebowitz.
